meanings.definition: To remove from sight or view.
meanings.sent1: She quickly unsights the mess in her room before guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The magician unsights the rabbit from the hat with a swift motion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat unsights the toy mouse, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The fog unsights the distant mountains, shrouding them in mystery.
meanings.sent5: The detective unsights the clue in the cluttered room, revealing the hidden truth.

meanings.definition: Lacking in pleasing or attractive sights.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned house had an unsights appearance with broken windows and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent2: The alley behind the restaurant was dark and unsights, deterring customers.
meanings.sent3: The unsights painting failed to capture the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent4: The old, unsights building stood out among the modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The movie set was intentionally made to look unsights to fit the post-apocalyptic theme.
